com.abc

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abc.Customer

  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class for the Customer. It contains an ArrayList of the Accounts held by the customer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Customer(java.lang.String name, Bank bank)
      This is the constructor for the Customer class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDailyInterest()
      This function adds the daily interest to all of the Accounts held by this Customer
      java.lang.String getName()
      This function returns the name of the Customer
      int getNumberOfAccounts()
      A function that returns the number of Accounts held by this Customer.
      java.lang.String getStatement()
      This function generates a nicely formatted String describing the list of Transactions in all Accounts held by this Customer
      Account openAccount(int accountType)
      This function creates a new Account and adds it to the LinkedList of Accounts belonging to this Customer
      double totalInterestEarned()
      This function works out the total amount of interest earned in a year across all Accounts held by this Customer.
      void transferFundsBetweenAccounts(Account from, Account to, double amount)
      A function that transfers a given amount of money from one given account to another given account.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String name,
                Bank bank)
        This is the constructor for the Customer class. It takes a name to give the customer and a Bank to register the customer with.
        Parameters:
        name - A String representing the name of this Customer
        bank - A Bank that this Customer shall be registered with

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This function returns the name of the Customer
        Returns:
        The String that represents this Customer's name

      • openAccount

        public Account openAccount(int accountType)
        This function creates a new Account and adds it to the LinkedList of Accounts belonging to this Customer
        Parameters:
        accountType - An integer between 0 and 2 representing CHECKING, SAVINGS, and MAXI_SAVINGS. See Account docs for more info.
        Returns:
        The new Account object generated by this function.

      • getNumberOfAccounts

        public int getNumberOfAccounts()
        A function that returns the number of Accounts held by this Customer.
        Returns:
        An Integer which describes how many Accounts this Customer has

      • totalInterestEarned

        public double totalInterestEarned()
        This function works out the total amount of interest earned in a year across all Accounts held by this Customer.
        Returns:
        A double representing the amount of monetary interest earned in a year across all Accounts held by this Customer

      • addDailyInterest

        public void addDailyInterest()
        This function adds the daily interest to all of the Accounts held by this Customer

      • getStatement

        public java.lang.String getStatement()
        This function generates a nicely formatted String describing the list of Transactions in all Accounts held by this Customer
        Returns:
        A nicely formatted String describing the list of Transactions in all Accounts held by this Customer

      • transferFundsBetweenAccounts

        public void transferFundsBetweenAccounts(Account from,
                                         Account to,
                                         double amount)
        A function that transfers a given amount of money from one given account to another given account.
        Parameters:
        from - An Account from which the money shall be withdrawn. If the Account does not have enough funds, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown If the Account does not belong to this Customer an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        to - The Account which the money shall be deposited into. If the Account does not have enough funds, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown If the Account does not belong to this Customer an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        amount - A double representing the amount of money to be transferred from the first Account to the second The double must not have more than 2 decimal places as it is impossible to have 0.001 dollars The double must not be negative
